medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain and chronic recurrent urticarial skin rash.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms have been present for nine months, with the patient experiencing abdominal pain and a chronic recurrent skin rash characterized by oral mucosal ulcerations and diffuse purpuric and urticarial lesions on multiple locations in the body. Symptoms showed improvement following treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of seropositive rheumatoid arthritis and venous thromboembolism, for which he is anticoagulated with apixaban.
